title: Authentic Assessment Design in Higher Education: Microlearning for Language Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Language instruction experience in secondary education settings and foundational assessment design knowledge
context.additional_context: Microlearning program for in-service secondary language teachers to support long-term, continuous learning in smartphone-based mobile environments.

learning_goals: Learners can design authenticity assessments utilizing three theoretical perspectives (psychological fidelity, ontological fidelity, and practical theory)
Learners can develop assessment tasks linked to real-world tasks in language education settings while reflecting evolving societal demands
Learners can analyze trade-offs and improve assessment designs through peer feedback in mobile-based microlearning environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
